main_definition: Nine refers to the natural number following eight and preceding ten, as well as a common idiomatic expression.

meanings_and_examples.example: When I count on my fingers from 1 to 10, the last finger has the number nine.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Referring to a group of nine items.
meanings_and_examples.example: There are nine apples in the fruit basket.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used as a metaphor for completeness or totality, especially when applied to groups or sequences.
meanings_and_examples.example: If all the pieces of the puzzle come together, they can be said to make 'nine'. Similarly, if nine out of ten doctors agree on something, it is widely accepted.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A colloquial way of indicating a high number or degree.
meanings_and_examples.example: She has nine chances left before the game starts.
